name: Sachse Muslim Society
mission: Sachse Muslim Society (SMS) is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that was established in 2014. We are dedicated to religious education and community service. SMS serves Sachse, Wylie, Rowlett, North Garland, Rockwall, and Murphy communities.
theoryOfChange: By providing structured Quranic education and a physical masjid space, the organization aims to revive hearts and nurture the spiritual and intellectual growth of the next generation of Muslims.
zakatClaimEvidence: Found 'zakat al-fitr' on https://sachsemasjid.org/ (https://sachsemasjid.org/); Website mission/programs mention zakat

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: fi_sabilillah (+5); Humanitarian service (+2)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 29/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, religious cultural cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Track and report beneficiary counts to enable cost analysis
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Build working capital reserves to 1-3 months of operating expenses
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes for 3+ years
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with causal pathway
components.name: Theory of Change

judge_issues.message: The rationale mentions "exceptional financial stability and fundraising efficiency" as a strength, but the Charity Navigator score is 20/100, indicating significant financial concerns. This is a tone mismatch.

The impact rationale mentions "direct provision" but doesn't adequately address the critically low program expense ratio (14%) which significantly lowers the impact score. This is a key factor that should be emphasized.

risks.risk_summary: Key concern: Program expense ratio critically low: 14%

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Sachse Muslim Society earns 37/100 due to good alignment and limited impact, with zakat compliance (significant risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Found 'zakat al-fitr' on https://sachsemasjid.org/ (https://sachsemasjid.org/); Website mission/programs mention zakat

all_citations.claim: The organization operates the Sachse Quran Academy (SQA) and offers Full Time and Part Time Hifz programs.
The organization is Zakat-eligible and provides specific giving methods for donors.
The society utilizes volunteer engagement for community service and religious events.
Total revenue was $2,799,757 with a fundraising efficiency of $0.11 per $1 raised and a program expense ratio of 13.6%.
The organization holds 63.0 months of working capital.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization receives a moderate overall score due to its exceptional financial stability and fundraising efficiency, balanced against a low program expense ratio and limited public data regarding direct impact metrics.
areas_for_improvement: Low program expense ratio of 13.6%, suggesting a high proportion of funds are held in reserve or directed toward non-programmatic costs [4][5]
Limited external data availability and third-party verification of program outcomes [5]

dimension_explanations.alignment: Alignment is high for Muslim donors due to the organization's Zakat-eligible status and its focus on religious and cultural preservation through Hifdh programs [1][2].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates direct provision of services through its Quran Academy, though its impact score is limited by a 13.6% program expense ratio and a lack of third-party outcome verification [1][4][5].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Sachse Muslim Society is a community-focused religious organization dedicated to Quranic education and spiritual service in the Sachse area.
strengths: High liquidity with 63.0 months of working capital available to sustain operations [4][5]
Strong fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.11 per $1 raised [4]
Diverse educational programming including Full Time Hifdh and Part Time Hifz options [1]
baseline_narrative.summary: founded in 2014, the Sachse Muslim Society operates the Sachse Quran Academy, providing specialized religious education through Full Time and Part Time Hifz programs [1][4]. The organization is recognized as Zakat-eligible and maintains a strong focus on community engagement through volunteer-led committees [2][3].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization receives a moderate overall score due to its exceptional financial stability and fundraising efficiency, balanced against a low program expense ratio and limited public data regarding direct impact metrics.

areas_for_improvement.context: The <cite id="6">program expense ratio of 13.6%</cite> is significantly below the <cite id="12">peer median of 80.0%</cite>, suggesting that more funds could be deployed directly into educational services.
With a <cite id="13">minimal board of 3 members</cite> and low data transparency scores, the organization lacks the independent oversight typical of larger institutions.

bbb_assessment.summary: This organization has not yet been evaluated by the BBB Wise Giving Alliance.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization appears to be in a capital-intensive growth phase, which may explain the high asset accumulation and low current program spending.
risk_factors: <cite id="16">Excessive liquidity (63 months)</cite> suggests inefficient use of immediate donations
<cite id="13">Small board size (3 members)</cite> limits independent governance oversight
case_against.summary: The primary concern is the <cite id="6">low program expense ratio</cite>, which indicates that less than 40 cents of every dollar donated is currently spent on direct services.

confidence.notes: Financial stability is high, but programmatic transparency is limited.

alignment.explanation: Alignment is high for Muslim donors as the organization is <cite id="7">Zakat-eligible</cite> and serves a <cite id="18">niche religious-cultural cause</cite> within the North Texas Muslim community.

credibility.explanation: Credibility is supported by the organization's <cite id="14">12-year track record</cite> and consistent filing of <cite id="4">Form 990 tax returns</cite>. However, <cite id="15">data confidence remains low (0.3)</cite> due to a lack of third-party audits and minimal public transparency regarding board governance.
credibility.improvement: The organization could improve credibility by <cite id="13">expanding its board size</cite> beyond three members and publishing audited financial statements.

impact.explanation: Impact is driven by <cite id="2">direct provision of religious education</cite>, but the overall score is tempered by a <cite id="6">13.6% program ratio</cite> and <cite id="16">excessive working capital reserves</cite> that exceed industry norms.
impact.improvement: To improve impact, the charity should <cite id="17">track and report beneficiary counts</cite> to enable cost-per-student analysis and deploy more reserves into active programming.

rich_narrative.headline: The Sachse Muslim Society is a community-focused religious organization dedicated to Quranic education and spiritual service in the Sachse area.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for local donors in North Texas who want to invest in the long-term physical and educational infrastructure of a growing masjid and Quran academy.
donor_motivations: Want to support the establishment of a permanent Islamic institution in the Sachse area
Prioritize Zakat-eligible Quranic education for youth
Value financial stability and low fundraising overhead
giving_considerations: Donations may be held in reserve for future expansion rather than immediate spending
Governance is centralized within a small board
Limited data is available regarding specific student outcomes
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking high immediate 'pass-through' of funds to beneficiaries or those requiring rigorous third-party impact evaluations.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects <cite id="17">unverified outcomes</cite> and a lack of external evaluation, though direct service delivery is documented.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The organization operates on the premise that providing structured Quranic memorization and Islamic education strengthens the spiritual identity and communal cohesion of the local Muslim population.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Tracking student graduation rates and Hifz completion would help donors understand the educational efficacy of the academy.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: While the charity has high reserves, its <cite id="11">$4.2 million in liabilities</cite> and rapid growth suggest a need for continued capital to complete institutional projects.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by <cite id="4">extraordinary 290.8% revenue growth</cite> but lags behind the <cite id="12">80% peer program ratio median</cite>.

strengths.detail: The organization maintains <cite id="5">63.0 months of working capital</cite>, providing a massive buffer for long-term sustainability and future capital projects.
The society demonstrates strong fiscal discipline in its development efforts, spending only <cite id="9">$0.11 to raise every $1</cite> in contributions.
The charity has seen explosive growth with a <cite id="4">revenue CAGR of 290.8%</cite> over the last three years, reflecting strong community trust and support.

strengths_deep_dive: The Sachse Muslim Society's primary strength lies in its robust financial position and its role as a specialized educational provider. By focusing on <cite id="2">Full Time Hifdh and Nadirah programs</cite>, it fills a specific niche in the religious landscape of North Texas. Its financial health is characterized by <cite id="10">total assets of $8,345,604</cite> against <cite id="11">liabilities of $4,214,500</cite>, suggesting a strong net asset position of over $4 million. This capital base allows the organization to operate with <cite id="9">minimal fundraising overhead</cite>, ensuring that donor outreach remains cost-effective while the institution scales its physical and educational infrastructure.
rich_narrative.summary: founded in 2014, the Sachse Muslim Society serves as a vital religious and educational hub for the Muslim community in <cite id="1">Sachse, Wylie, Rowlett, and surrounding North Texas areas</cite>. The organization primarily operates the Sachse Quran Academy (SQA), which offers specialized <cite id="2">Full Time Hifdh and Part Time Hifz programs</cite> alongside Sunday School and summer intensives. Financially, the society reported <cite id="3">$2,799,757 in total revenue for 2023</cite>, representing a significant <cite id="4">3-year revenue CAGR of 290.8%</cite>. While the organization maintains <cite id="5">high liquidity with 63.0 months of working capital</cite>, its current <cite id="6">program expense ratio stands at 13.6%</cite>, indicating that a substantial portion of its capital is currently held in reserve or allocated toward long-term infrastructure rather than immediate service delivery. The society is <cite id="7">recognized as Zakat-eligible</cite>, specifically serving the asnaf of Fi Sabilillah through its educational mission. Operations are heavily supported by <cite id="8">volunteer-led committees</cite> that manage everything from facility maintenance to community outreach, ensuring a grassroots connection to the local congregation.
